intro: Lamechites schlechteri, commonly known as the African buttercup, is a flowering plant native to southern Africa. It belongs to the family Ranunculaceae, which includes many showy, often toxic, herbaceous plants. The plant features heart-shaped leaves and produces yellow flowers with five petals, typical of the family. It thrives in moist, well-drained soils and is often found in forest understories. Due to its ornamental value, it is sometimes cultivated in gardens, though it can be invasive in certain regions.
